intro: Diasperus baladensis, commonly known as the Balad sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its seeds are enclosed in a unique, ribbed fruit that aids in wind dispersal. Diasperus baladensis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments.
